item.title: [GROOVY-3208] Static properties of Groovy classes not seen by subclasses
item.description:
following test throws MissingPropertyException. We somehow fail to resolve static property in super class

package groovy.bugs

public class StaticPropertyInSuperClassBug extends GroovyTestCaseTest {
void testBug () {
new Sub().each

{ it.doIt() }

}
}

class Super {
static final String PROP = "ABC"

def doIt =

{ PROP }

}

class Sub extends Super {
}

item.summary: Static properties of Groovy classes not seen by subclasses

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Note that if doIt() is implemented as a method instead of a closure, I think the test passes.

I've committed what I think is a mostly correct fix for GROOVY-3211. That enables the current test case to pass, but there is more to this issue (and perhaps a separate issue) in that superclass static properties are not visible in static contexts of subclasses.
This patch adds the static context tests to the test case. Not committed to trunk since it breaks the build.
The fix for GROOVY-3211 is now committed to 1.6. That is a partial fix for this issue. The problem with static properties in static contexts remains.

the remaining possible issue has nothing to do with this issue, since it gives a compilation error. The compiler likes you to force the usage of a qualified name for the static property. For example Super.PROP. If the program is corrected like that, then the test does not fail. If we want the compiler to be able to do that, then please fill a new issue and mark it is a future request or as improvement. And surely it would not get the level critical
